properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 5 at 7:53AM MST until February 8 at 5:00AM MST by NWS Cheyenne WY
properties.description:
...BLOWING AND DRIFTING SNOW LIKELY IN THE WIND PRONE AREAS OF
SOUTHEAST WYOMING THROUGH MID DAY THURSDAY...

...BLIZZARD CONDITIONS POSSIBLE ALONG INTERSTATE 80 WEST OF
LARAMIE THURSDAY NIGHT AND FRIDAY...WITH HEAVY SNOW LIKELY
SPREADING INTO THE INTERSTATE 25 CORRIDOR...

* WHAT...Blizzard conditions possible. Total snow accumulations
of 4 to 6 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph.

* WHERE...Laramie Valley. The worst conditions will be found
outside of Laramie. The city of Laramie could see considerably
less snowfall than areas immediately outside of town.

* WHEN...Thursday afternoon through late Friday night.

* IMPACTS...Extremely dangerous or impossible travel due to icy,
snow covered roads and near whiteout conditions.
properties.instruction:
Prepare for possible blizzard conditions. Continue to monitor the
latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM THURSDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... ...WIND CHILL WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 8 AM MST THIS MORNING
